content: imbolc mitts ever since i learned larger significance of ground hogs day how it fits directly between the winter solstice and the equinox-- it s become a favorite holiday yes it s still winter but the light is returning now at a gallop instead of a creep the sap is beginning to rise in the trees- you can tell by the way the snow melts around the trunks rumor has it the burrowing animals are giving birth to their young spring isn t here yet but it will come this pattern makes good use of leftover yarn from other projects yarn 47 grams in total of worsted weight yarn in two colors tools us 8 and us 5 or 6 double pointed needles for thumb if desired yarn needle cast on loosely 36 stitches join in round corrugated rib k1 p1 by purling in color b and knitting in color a for 9 row increase row in color a knit 2 make 1 k14 m1 k 4 m1 k14 m1 k2 40 stitches pattern row 1 k2 color a k1 color b k3 a repeat till 2 stitches left k1 b k1 a row 2 and 4 knit in color a row 3 k1 color b k3 a repeat till end knit in pattern to thumb opening about two inches for my large hands thumb opening continue pattern purling on even numbered row for about 10-12 row tip when starting an odd number row leave a long enough tail with your color b yarn so you can use it on the next odd number row and have fewer ends to weave in knit pattern for about an inch ending on even numbered row knit another 5 row of corrugated rib cast off in color a for thumb optional switching to smaller needles and using color b pickup 16-18 stitches knit in round for about 5 row then k rib or seed stitch for three row cast off weave in ends using yarn needle
